column3: SH 188 between FM 1069 and FM 136 closed west of Rockport until further notice due to bridge abutment erosion. Use alternate route.
SH 35 in Refugio County is closed at SH 239 in Tivoli due to water over road at Calhoun County line. TxDOT crews placing barricades.
TxDOT awaits Coast Guard OK to restart Port Aransas ferries. For now, still closed to public. TxDOT ready to go. Diver checks landings.
Just a glimpse of the 100s of pieces of heavy equipment TxDOT has moved to Coastal Bend for Harvey response. Each truck has full crew.
TxDOT crews setting the day's game plan, loading material and moving throughout Coastal Bend in continuing TxDOT response to Harvey's visit.
TxDOT crews xcellent progress Harvey signal, sign work. ~ 175 signals inspected, repair/replace. Refugio, Rockport done. Corpus work here.
Mobile hospital set up on FM 3512 at McCampbell Airport near Ingleside. For information dial 1680 AM.
TxDOT Benjamin Soria (ctr) of Ft. Worth is 53 today. He’s celebrating 400 miles away in Rockport, restoring traffic signs Harvey destroyed.
Port Aransas ferry system CLOSED to public. No access to Port Aransas from Aransas Pass. Use SH 361 northbound from Corpus Christi.
TXDOT road debris clearing, and traffic signal and sign repair continues on state roads in the coastal bend area
Gov. Abbott, in Corpus Christi, calls Harvey response nothing short of remarkable. Says President Trump also impressed.
Please use SH 361 NB out of Corpus Christi to enter Port Aransas. Ferries have not reopened to public.
Surge wall, ferry access limited to Harvey recovery crews. Public enters Port Aransas on SH 361 NB from Corpus Christi til further notice.
TxDOT crews replacing Harvey-damaged traffic signals on US 77 in Odem. TxDOT performing similar recovery work throughout the Coastal Bend.
TxDOT reinforcements continue to arrive in Corpus Christi District. Signal crews from throughout state assisting with Harvey recovery.
TxDOT sign and traffic signal crews have arrived along the Texas coast affected by Hurricane Harvey to assist with sign and signal repairs
Turn Around Don’t Drown - 6 in. of water is all it takes to make your car float away. It’s not worth the risk. Never touch downed powerlines
Flash flooding is the leading cause of weather-related deaths in Texas. If you encounter a flooded road, Turn Around, Don’t Drown.
Collapsed sign bridge removed from I-37 northbound at Navigation Blvd. I-37 NB expected to reopen within the hour. I-37 southbound open.
Added TxDOT crews en route to CRP District to assist with getting traffic signals operational. Initial focus: hard hit Rockport, Refugio.
Be Safe. Drive Smart. Visit http://DriveTexas.org or call 800-452-9292 to chk highway conditions & notices for rd closures due to flooding
I-37 southbound is open, but please be careful and give TxDOT crews room to work. Large crane being dispatched to remove sign structure.
TxDOT rolled this morning to assess Harvey damage, clear roads for 1st responders in Rockport, other areas. 250-300 TxDOT CRP folks on job.
Update: Only I-37 NB closed. I-37 SB now open.
Only I-37 NB closed at Navigation Blvd due to collapsed overhead sign structure. I-37 southbound open.
For road conditions statewide, check Texas TxDOT Highway Conditions: 1-800-452-9292 or http://www.drivetexas.org
TxDOT ferry crews worked hard this morning to evacuate Port Aransas in heavy weather as Harvey advanced and then secured the vessels.
TxDOT prepares for Harvey. Surge wall complete in Aransas Pass. TxDOT crews from Rockport, Refugio, Beeville made it happen.
TxDOT storm surge wall be complete shortly on SH 361 in Aransas Pass. Protect people & property from Harvey surge. It's part of levee system
Port aransas ferry closing @8 am. Surge wall in aransa pass in place by 9 am only evac route from port aransas will be SH 361 SB to Corpus
Due to worsening conditions, Port Aransas ferry system will shut down operations in next 2-3 hours. Two boats currently in service.
